boardgame.name: The Spire Labyrinthine
boardgame.description:
Welcome to the Spire Labyrinthine, a foreboding district of crumbling gothic architecture, hidden secrets, and foul monsters.

The Spire Labyrinthine is a supplement for the Slayers RPG and contains;

Three new classes

*The teleporting Warper
*The bargaining Karcist
*the mystical Fatebinder


A new district to slot into your Slayers Game

The Spire Labyrinthine, a district of hidden streets and soaring ruins.


Four new monsters to hunt through the streets or be stalked by in the night.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Bimba: What Do You See
boardgame.description:
Rediscover the power of your imagination as you take on the role of a storyteller. Use the Bimba Cards to interpret phrases in your own unique way. Then convince your fellow players that your interpretation is the most meaningful. Score points for every vote you get and every vote you can sway in your favour. You win if you have the highest number of points at the end of the game.

Game Play..

Each player is dealt with 5 cards and as game begins, One player picks a phrase card and reads it out to the other players,

Each other player selects the card in their hands that best matches the phrase and gives the selected card to the dealer, without showing it to the others.

The dealer shuffles the cards with all the received cards. All pictures are shown face up and every player votes for the cards that best suits the phrase. They cannot vote for their own card. Then one of the player challenges the votes and tries to convince the others about why another card is better suited and pitch for it. Players can tell stories, bring out instances to convince the other players to change their votes. The challenger scores one pink token for every vote they turn in their favour.

Players score points for every vote for their own card and collects the tokens.

Apart from the phrase cards, players can opt to create their own Stories, Verse, Phrase or a word. If they win this round, they get an additional 20 points apart from the votes.
The game ends when the deck is empty or when the players decide to end the game.

The base game and all expansions have 84 main Bimba cards each with phrase cards, Vote cards, 1 play mat, 84 winning tokens and 1 Rule book.

boardgame.description: Fantasy

boardgame.name: The Fort
boardgame.description: The objective of The Fort is to knock down men consisting of a King, a Queen, their Bishops, and Guards. Players use a cue to push balls into a U-shaped fort with the men placed in predefined positions.

boardgame.name: Call to Adventure: Name of the Wind – Worldbuilders Exclusive: Secret Friend & Hero of Destiny (alt card)
boardgame.description:
Alternate artwork for previously released Hero of Destiny card featuring Kvothe.

All new promo card Secret Friend featuring Auri.

Worldbuilders-exclusive, originally available in return for donation through the 2019 Worldbuilders fundraiser.

Cards bundled together, not available separately.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Call to Adventure: The Name of the Wind

boardgame.name: The Petal Hack 2nd Ed.
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Tékumel is a place with the politics and intrigue of the Roman Empire, the religions of ancient India and pre-Columbian Mesoamerica, the magic of the Arabian Nights, the monsters and demons of the Cthulhu mythos, plus ancient ruins containing the technology of a good space opera thrown in just to keep things interesting.

The Petal Hack strips the rules down to a minimum so you can focus on character and setting.

The Second Edition updates the rules to The Black Hack 2nd Edition as well as other changes totaling 32 additional pages.

boardgame.name: Pax Porfiriana/Pax Transhumanity: Folding Board
boardgame.description: Double-sided game board, one side for Pax Porfiriana, and the other for Pax Transhumanity.

boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn: The Character Vault
boardgame.description:
The Red Dragon Inn Character Vault: Remember when we said earlier that we would consider a new storage solution, but that it wouldn't be a part of this campaign? Turns out we managed to put something together in time to offer it as an add-on. Presenting The Red Dragon Inn Character Vault!

What is the Character Vault? It's a new overflow storage solution for those who need it. It has the same dimensions and internal layout as an RDI 5 box—it's about 12.5"×15.5"×4", and divided into 4 columns, with a subdivided well in the corner for oversize cards and player mats.

The Character Vault will be offered as an add on for $30.

Here are three important things that the Character Vault is not:

The Character Vault is NOT a bigger storage box than the others that already exist. As we've stated before, we do not intend to make a larger storage box than this.
The Character Vault is NOT a new game product. It has no contents at all—no new characters, no promo cards, no foam blocks, no plastic baggies, nothing. It's just a new storage box.
As with the metal Coins of the World, The Character Vault is NOT a Kickstarter exclusive, nor is it attached to a pledge level. It is simply a new product that you will be among the first to have access to.


— description from the publisher

Announced during the The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl Kickstarter (Update #22).

32×39×10.5 cm, 1.06 kg
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove
The Red Dragon Inn 7: The Tavern Crew
The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl

boardgame.name: Attacktica
boardgame.description:
Attacktica is a two player abstract strategy game with dice to show you how to move.
Each player has 4 ships with 20 life points with maximum 6 life points per ship.
There are 2 sea monsters which are used from both sides.


Life points are divided up to each ship, the life points are not visible from the opponent.
Two dice per player, dice one; is for which ship or sea monster is to move and dice two; is for the amount of moves or life points to be taken, depending if it is stage one or stage two of the game.
Stage One; One ship must reach the opponents start port to declare war.
Stage Two, when two opposite ships are aligned, battle can commence.
The two sea monsters play a big role in the game, they can obstruct ships, they can give moves and they can give and take life points, depending on the dice.
The winner is the player with the last ship/ships in the play arena.


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn: Coins of the World
boardgame.description:
And yes, we WILL be offering metal versions of the "Coins of the World". Here's what we know so far: Campaign Coins is creating prototypes for each of the coins, including several different flavors of the large elf coin. We will be offering a product as an add-on that has 10 of each of the five coin designs in a drawstring bag. Final price point will be determined mainly by which of the elf coin designs we decide is the best. This will not be a Kickstarter exclusive or attached to any pledge level. It is simply a new product we are offering, and you will be among the first people to have access to it. We will keep you posted as we know more.

—description from the publisher

From the The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl Kickstarter, update #22.

The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl

boardgame.name: CORONA NERVT!
boardgame.description:
At the beginning each player has 5 action cards, 5 coronas & 5 nerve cards in hand. Try to keep your nerve in this card game. You only have five of them at the beginning. In return, you should do everything you can to get rid of the coronas. Whoever got rid of all of their coronas first wins the game.

There are 60 action cards in the game. One action card is played per round. If you demonstrate strategic skill, you win the card game at the end.

As soon as a player falls below 0 nerve cards, he is eliminated. So you always have to have at least one of these nerve cards in hand.

When it is your turn, you have the option of using your action cards to have an effect on all players or only on a certain player - you can assign them even more coronas or take away nerves. After you have played an action card, you draw a new one. You continue to play until the stack of cards is used up or a player has already got rid of all his coronas or all others have lost their nerve.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Bei CORONA NERVT! starten alle MitspielerInnen mit 5 Nerv-, 5 Corona- und 5 Spielkarten. Die Aufgabe ist es nun Coronas loszuwerden, dabei die Nerven beisammenzuhalten und dies mit den eigenen Spielkarten geschickt zu steuern.

Wenn mich beispielsweise meine MitspielerInnen besuchen, setzen wir uns alle einem bewussten Risiko aus und erhalten daher alle eine Coronakarte und müssen eine Nervkarte abgeben. Nur nicht die Nerven verlieren und Corona wieder loswerden. Das ist die Strategie!

Es ist doch echt frustrierend, da hat schon wieder jemand beim Niesen nicht den Ellenbogen davorgehalten und im Bus trägt der Sitznachbar die Maske unter der Nase! Zack wieder drei Coronas gesammelt und drei Nerven verloren. Aber da! Ein Lichtblick! Impfstofflieferung in Sicht und endlich Sommer!

Ein schnelles Spiel in dem man nicht nur die eigenen Karten im Blick behalten muss, sondern auch die der MitspielerInnen. Kann ich mit der nächsten Karte eine/n MitspielerIn rausschmeißen? Wer ist fast geheilt und braucht dringend mal wieder eine Schippe Corona? Werde deine Coronas los, behalte die Nerven und bring die anderen zur Verzweiflung.

Dieses spannende Spiel, versüß die Zeit nicht nur im Lockdown und lässt uns über Corona und seine Auswirkungen auch mal schmunzeln!

Wer gute Nerven beweist und alle eigenen Coronas besiegt, gewinnt das Spiel. Wir sagen DANKE Jana!!

boardgame.name: Forge of Nations: The Strategy Card Game
boardgame.description:
A history-themed card drafting and city building game commemorating two hundred years of Singapore's history.

Player starts with a jungle, and your job is to grow it to a village, town and towards a city.

This can be done through growing the four developmental pillars of your settlement: Population, Economy, Governance, Infrastructure. During your turn, you can a) build your settlement, b) trade with fellow players or c) cause crisis situations to them. Grow your settlement while watching out for your rivals. First player to build the city wins.

Depending on the specific pillars you draft and build, grow your city to either a hippie tourism spot, economic bustling city with governance, or offshore gambling den... the possibilities of your settlement are endless!

boardgame.name: Pizza Delivery: Playmats
boardgame.description: A neoprene board and 5 player mats, each with spaces for equipment (transportation and pizza bags), and a short overview of the icons and their meaning in the game.

boardgame.name: Nearly Heroes
boardgame.description:
A new arena has just been opened to the public and needs groups of brave participants willing to test their mettle and skill in the arts of combat.
Defeat all your enemies and receive ultimate glory as Heroes of the Land. Should you fail, worry not, you will be remembered as Nearly Heroes.

Nearly Heroes is a cooperative game where you and your friends compete in an arena against exotic enemies. The only thing is that our Heroes aren’t quite heroes. None of them are trained or skilled enough to wield the weapons they come across and suffer greatly for their misuse.
They’ve gotten in way over their heads and it’s up to you to lead them to victory together through strategy and a heavy dose of luck.

boardgame.name: Frozen Winds: Seas of Ice
boardgame.description:
Frozen Winds: Seas of Ice is a fast-paced naval miniatures wargame set in a DaVinci inspired ice age.

The planet has frozen over.
Gale-force winds howl across the ice as you maneuver your ice skiffs to dominate the frigid domain.
Based on ships of the line style naval games, Seas of Ice plays much, much faster.

A two-player game with half a dozen ships can be played out in about 30 minutes.
A six-player game with 20 to 30 boats can run for an afternoon on a kitchen table.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Silver Bayonet
The Silver Bayonet: A Wargame of Napoleonic Gothic Horror
boardgame.description:
As the wars of Napoleon ravage Europe, chaos and fear reign and the darkness that once clung to the shadows has been emboldened. Supernatural creatures — vampires, werewolves, ghouls, and worse — take advantage of the havoc, striking out at isolated farms, villages, and even military units.

Riflemen, swordsmen, and engineers fight side-by-side with mystics, occultists, and even those few supernatural creatures that can be controlled or reasoned with enough to make common cause. The Silver Bayonet: A Wargame of Napoleonic Gothic Horror can be played solo, co-operatively, or competitively, with players progressing through a series of interlinked adventures with their soldiers gaining experience and suffering grievous wounds, and their units triumphing...or falling in the face of the shadows.

It is a game of action and adventure where musket and saber meet tooth and claw.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Miniatures Rules Judges Award Winner
2022 UK Games Expo Best Miniatures Rules Nominee
2022 UK Games Expo Best Miniatures Rules People's Choice Award Winner

boardgame.name: A Kingly Fight: The Battle of Bouvines, July 27, 1214
boardgame.description:
“The knights and the auxiliaries, armed and arranged into ordered echelons, prepared in all haste for the battle. The horses’ bridles were tightened by the auxiliaries. The armour shone in the splendor of the sun and it seemed that the light of day was doubled. The banners unfolded in the winds and offered themselves to the currents; they presented a delightful spectacle to the eyes.” –comment by the author of the Relation Marchianensis de Pugna Bovinis on the French army’s preparation for battle.

Following the Third Crusade tensions among the monarchs of Western Europe was at a new high. Otto IV, King of Portugal and newly crowned Holy Roman Emperor was facing revolt in the German provinces, many of whom were actively supported by the French King, Philip II, The Emperor had also garnered the enmity of Pope Innocent III soon after he was crowned when Otto claimed the Kingdom of Sicily, which he then attacked in 1209, which caused the Pope to excommunicate him. English King, John, was also involved with a growing conflict with the French, who were steadily taking lands along the border with Normandy. Indeed, John had only recently assumed the thrown following the death of his older brother, Richard (the Lionhearted) during a siege to retake one of the castles the French had captured earlier while the English king was on crusade. Tensions boiled over to outright war when the Pope authorized King Philip to launch a crusade against the upstart Holy Roman Emperor and his allies. The Battle of Bouvines, fought near the city of Tournai, was one of the largest ever fought in the Medieval period, and its outcome would affect the course of history for centuries.

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterpart?

—description from the designer

listing.notes:
For sale is a brand new copy of A Kingly Fight by the designer and publisher.
Mounted counters can be had for an additional $8.00.
A custom card set for the game is also available. The Kingly Fight card set replaces the standard deck of playing cards called for in the rules, feature graphics by the same artist that did the game's, and has rules reminders on pertinent cards. The Kingly Fight card set is an additional $10.00.
Paypal gladly accepted. Check or money order only from a domestic USA customer.

boardgame.name: You Decide
boardgame.description:
Our debut game, You Decide, is a roll and move game full of choices! With each move, You Decide which choice gives you the best chance of getting your pawns to Finish, first! Sometimes your choice involves moving an opponent back! Really want to make things interesting? Play the optional "Snake Eye Switch" where you get to switch places with an opponent, and vice versa!

A single You Decide game is for 2 players, but have your guests bring their You Decide game and add up to two more players per game, laying the boards side by side for the ultimate party game!

Will your decisions make YOU the WINNER?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aus der Zeit des großen Königs
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: Airplane Race
boardgame.description:
The objective of the game is to be the first to get his/her whole field cleared of planes. Each player takes turns spinning a spinner and clearing a hangar of his/her plane which number the spinner lands on. The first to clear all six planes win.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Die goldene Gans
boardgame.description:
The players start at space 1. The first to reach space 45 wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces events hinder the players. Te effects differ according to the chosen mode of transportation of each player. The players may use an automobile, a bicycle, a coach, a horse or travel by foot. Also the result of the dice roll is used differently:
Automobile and bike: the result counts double
Coach and horse: the results count normal.
Pedestrian: 1=0, 2=1, 3=1, 4=2, 5=2, 6=3.
The pedestrians may use the 3 shortcuts, if the reach the appropriate spaces.
The faster the mode of transportation, the worse are the effects of the event spaces. There are no ill effects for the pedestrians at all.

—user summary
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

boardgame.name: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Peace at Any Cost
La Légende des Cinq Anneaux JCE: La Paix à tout Prix
boardgame.description:
The future of Rokugan hangs in the balance with the Temptations cycle for Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game!

As dark forces move throughout Rokugan in Peace at Any Cost, every clan is tempted to dabble in the forbidden arts of mahou, which requires fate to be spent from players' own characters. Hand-in-hand with this comes a new keyword, dire, which triggers when a character has no fate on it. As with previous cycles, every Dynasty Pack of this cycle offers sixty new cards, with new options for each of the seven Great Clans of Rokugan, split between strongholds, provinces, dynasty deck, and conflict deck.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Setting: Legend of the Five Rings
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game

listing.notes: Title: Legend of the Five Rings: The Card Game – Peace at Any Cost Publisher: Fantasy Flight Games Language(s): English

boardgame.name: The Art of Boxing Clever
boardgame.description:
Theme
The Art of Boxing Clever simulates almost all aspects of the real-life boxing match into a highly specific and player controlled, intense decision-making match experience. Aspects recreated in the board game include the stance and style of the boxers; boxer initiative, 10 attributes of the selected boxer; head/body area target selection; punch type selection, defence move selection; damage resistance attributes, increasing damage tracking; judge scoring, knockdown count sequence. In essence this unrivalled boxing game mechanism creates the feel of the real ebb and flow of a typical boxing match and the unpredictability of ‘one punch can make all the difference’.

Goal
The goal is to outthink and outmanoeuvre your opponent to consistently inflict damage by exploiting their weaknesses, whilst protecting your own. Damage is realised by the depletion of the opponent’s card hand until either the hand is completely depleted, or a KO or TKO is achieved through a visible damage tracking system.

Gameplay
The game centres around a timely selection of appropriate punch / defence cards from a tailored hand of cards specific to each fighter to inflict damage to selected areas of the opponent’s head and body. Damage is tracked and consequences are specific to each fighter.
Players select their boxer depending on style, stance and attributes.
For each match-up a predetermined hand of cards is dealt representing the attributes of the boxer.
A 10-round match with 3 scoring judges.
Each round takes the form of 5 mini-rounds which involves 5 turns of attacking and defending. Each turn includes 2 potentially defendable attack moves, one to a selected area of the head and one to an area of the body. The selection of the cards and target area is critical to achieve damage. Any damage inflicted is tracked on the gameboard and consequences to the opponent’s hand of cards is realised and the judges scoring is revealed.
The play sequence thereby creates poker style opportunities for bluffing and counter bluffing, minimizing ‘Chance’ to maximize player control, creating a high sense/degree of anticipation.
The variety of the cards provide multiple ways and exciting combinations to out manoeuvre your opponent. The highly player controlled mini rounds are countered by an unpredictable judge scoring system, potentially influencing player strategy.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: The Art of Boxing Clever: Arcade Mode Expansion Pack
The Art of Boxing Clever: Fighting Dirty Expansion Pack
The Art of Boxing Clever: Solo Play AI Expansion Pack

boardgame.name: The Soap Opera Game
boardgame.description:
In The Soap Opera Game players are aspiring soap opera stars. They roll and move around New York City trying to collect bit acting parts and roles in commercials.

Once a player has enough acting credits they can move to the central area of the board where they act in a soap opera and try to accumulate all the necessary plot elements: sex, health, disaster, marriage, economy, and crime. The first player to get all of these wins the game.

boardgame.name: Haunted Memories
boardgame.description:
Haunted Memories is a game of crumbling secrets, childhood memories, and hauntings.

Haunted Memories is a GM-less game to be played with up to 4 players, all former childhood friends. Years ago, they survived the Haunting, a nightmarish entity, but now it has returned and has brought them back together. The bonds they once shared are ravaged by time with secrets, lies, unsaid feelings, and only their memories of the past can help them prevail in the Present Day. But some secrets and memories are best left in the past.

You will need a Jenga tower to simulate the crumbling secrets and personas of the past and the present.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Monster at the End of the Nightmare
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Shade Haven is a newly founded desert frontier town, home to thrill seekers, fortune finders, and a seasonal influx of hunters who seek valuable jackalope antlers. However, an ancient and nearly omniscient evil lurks beneath the desert sands, waiting to devour everything. Only the party can thwart the evil and save the town.

Monster at the End of the Nightmare is a horror-themed desert adventure for a 5th level party in the Fifth Edition of the world's greatest roleplaying game.

boardgame.name: Generica Floorplans Volume 09: Brothel
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

GENERICA Floorplans are a combination of traditional 2D maps and 3D visual aids which can help you flesh out your campaign setting. Generic fantasy town locations (such as Taverns, Temples and Shops) are showcased with carefully designed floorplans and 3D rendered views to provide your players with a more immersive gaming experience.

Each GENERICA Floorplans volume contains one 3D Exterior Mapview, two isometric top-down Floorplan Maps, as well as additional 3D renders of Interior Mapviews. Each download also includes two full-sized gameplay maps designed to be printed at 16” x 20”.

boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Hinterland Mapview can help you minimize the amount of prep time for your next homebrew campaign!

GENERICA Floorplans are a combination of traditional 2D maps and 3D visual aids which can help you flesh out your campaign setting.
